block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Sound of Music.'' Matinee and evening performances Wednesdays through Sundays. Through September. Tickets: $46 to $66, including dinner. Discounts available for students, people 62 and older and children, at certain performances. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Sound of Music.'' Matinee and evening performances Wednesdays through Sundays. Through September. Tickets: $46 to $66, including dinner. Discounts available for students, people 62 and older and children, at certain performances. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presents ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' Today 6 p.m., with discussion with actors and the director after the performance; Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Tickets: $19 to $30, with discounts available, except Saturday evenings, for students, people 65 and older and children. Picnicking before shows. Picnic dinners available two days in advance. Cost: $16 and $18. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

GARRISON -- One-act festival featuring ''White Inferno'' by Catherine Gonick, ''Thirty Odd Years'' by Ric Siler and ''Monkey See, Monkey Voodoo'' by Bruce Pearl. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 5 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Philipstown Depot Theater. (845) 265-2797.
GOLDENS BRIDGE -- The play ''50,'' written and directed by Albi Gorn. Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $8. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.

HARTSDALE -- ''Secret Life of Walter Mitty,'' musical based on James Thurber story. Presented by Hartsdale Players. Today at 4 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $15; students, people 62 and older and children, $12. St. Paul's Methodist Church, 130 North Central Avenue. (914) 961-2055.
NYACK -- ''Forbidden Broadway,'' musical revue that parodies Broadway's biggest shows. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $35. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

PURCHASE -- Play Group Theater for children and young adults presenting ''Sweet Dreams.'' Today at 1 p.m. and tomorrow and Wednesday at 7 p.m. ''The Me Nobody Knows.'' Tonight, Tuesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and people 62 and older, $12; children, $10. Little Theater of Manhattanville College. (914) 946-0649.
Music and Dance
BRONXVILLE -- Gary Reynolds Jazz Combo. Presented by Eastchester Arts Council. Thursday at 7 p.m. Morange Park.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Kara Dago-Clarke, clarinetist, accompanied by Elizabeth Ball, bassoonist, and Hansani Archibald, composer and pianist. Includes selections by Beethoven and Mr. Archibald. Tomorrow at 7:30 P.M. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Bayou music festival, with performances by Gov't Mule, Disco Biscuits, Strangefolk, Ominous Seapods, Holden Truelove, Slick Pelt, Slam Allen and others. Next Saturday from noon to sundown. Performances by Little Feat, Shannon Curfman; Original P, with founding members of Parliament Funkadelic; Tab Benoit, Lil' Brian and the Zydeco Travelers, Popa Chubby and others. Next Sunday from noon to sundown. Tickets: $35 daily. Advance tickets: $28 daily; two-day pass, $40. Croton Point Park. (914) 699-5038.
DOBBS FERRY -- Houston Person, saxophonist, and Etta Jones, vocalist. Wednesday at 6:30 to 8 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (Rain site, Embassy Community Center, 60 Palisade Street.) (914) 631-1000.

FORDHAM -- ''Summer Breezes,'' selections by Haydn, Robert Baksa and Rheinberger. Presented by Bronx Arts Ensemble. Today at 4 p.m. Free. McGinley Center, Fordham University, Bronx Rose Hill Campus. (718) 601-7399.
GOLDENS BRIDGE -- Folk dancing led by Rose and Meir Beer. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Admission: $6. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.
KATONAH -- Brief recitals, followed by tours of house museum. Wednesdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $11; Friends of Caramoor, $9. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-5035.

MOUNT VERNON -- Houston Person, saxophonist, and Etta Jones, vocalist, performing with their quintet. Tuesday from 7:30 to 9 p.m. Free. Hartley Park, Gramatan and East Lincoln Avenues. (Rain site, Allen Memorial Church, Crary and Oakley Avenues.) (914) 631-1000.

MOUNT VERNON -- Listen to the songs of the Civil War, to understand the lives of soldiers. Wednesday at 12:15 p.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Traditional Latin American dances, by Alma Solana Dance Troupe. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

PAWLING -- Wholesale Klezmer Band. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Open mike night, with Scott Sylvester, host. Wednesday at 7 p.m. (Performers sign in from 5 to 7 p.m.) Tickets: $4. Cliff Eberhardt with guest artist, New Middle Class. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Clarence (Gatemouth) Brown with guest artist, Rick Ross. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $25; members, $22.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

RIVERDALE -- ''Summer Breezes,'' Bronx Arts Ensemble performs works by Haydn, Robert Baksa and Rheinberger. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Rockwood Drive Circle, Van Cortlandt Park. (Rain site, Church of the Mediator, Kingsbridge Avenue and West 231st Street.) (718) 601-7399.

RIVERDALE -- ''Sunset Wednesday,'' take part in a dance workshop, listen to Klezmer music of Zev Feldman; learn about tropical beds from gardener, Laurel Rimmer, or relax in the gardens. Wednesday from 6 to 7:30 p.m. Free with grounds admission: $4; students and people 60 and older, $2. Wave Hill, West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200.
SCARSDALE -- Summer sing of Mozart's ''Requiem''; Lyndon Woodside, conductor. Presented by Westchester Chorale. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Admission: $8. Scarsdale High School, Brewster Road. (914) 693-0990.
Films
PEEKSKILL -- ''Hamlet.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Admission: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Lectures
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Italian Language and Proverbs'' by Dr. Louis Miele, author of ''21st Century Italian.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
Art

BRONXVILLE -- ''Photographic Image -- A Roving Eye,'' photography by Robin Gneiting, Peter North, Lisa Sorensen, Luca Spallanzani and others and vintage prints by Louis Stettner. Through Sept. 8. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. (914) 337-4050.
DOBBS FERRY -- ''Seasons,'' landscapes and cityscapes by Patrick Antonelle. Through Sept. 6. Forever Gallery, 60 Cedar Street. (914) 674-8035.
GARRISON -- Collage, jewelry and works in clay by Theo. Opening reception Friday from 6 to 9 p.m. Through Sept. 4, by appointment. Whistlestop Gallery, 21 Lower Station Road. (845) 424-3794.
KATONAH -- Photography by Michael Kenna, Bogdan Konopka, Olivier Meriel and Pentti Sammallahti. Through Sept. 27. Candace Perich Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. (914) 232-3966.

GREENBURGH -- ''Painting My Story,'' paintings by Jennifer A. L. Scharbach. Through Next Sunday. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children 2 through 12, $2. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.

HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- ''Collection of Art Celebrating Our Native American Heritage,'' including jewelry, woven baskets, fetishes, beaded work and artifacts. Through August. Arctic Artistry, 2 Spring Street. (914) 478-7179.

PEEKSKILL -- ''Hot Stuff,'' photography, collage, sculpture, paintings and installation by Charlie Baker, Jo-Ann Brody, Jeanne Demotses, Nancy Faulds, Marcy B. Freedman and others. Through September. Reception next Saturday from 3 to 5 p.m. Jjenth Gallerie, 1006 Brown Street. (914) 737-1646.

PEEKSKILL -- ''Peekskill, New York and Nishijin, Japan's Artist Exchange'': Lisa Breznak and Jo-Ann Brody are first regional artists to take part in exchange sponsored by Peekskill Arts Council. Reception with artists, sampling of Japanese foods and sake and signed Japan-inspired handmade plate by either artist, to take home. Next Sunday from 4:30 to 7 p.m. Tax-deductible donation: $40. Reservations. Reservation deadline, tomorrow. Paramount East, 1016 Brown Street. (914) 737-6039.

POCANTICO HILLS -- Guided tours of the stained glass windows by Marc Chagall and Henri Matisse, commissioned by the Rockefeller family. Sundays from 2 to 5 p.m., Mondays and Wednesdays through Saturdays from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $3. Union Church of Pocantico Hills, 555 Bedford Road, Route 448. (914) 631-2069.
POUND RIDGE -- Photography by Ron Meyerson. Opening reception today from 3 p.m. Through Sept. 2. Hiram Halle Memorial Library, Westchester Avenue. (914) 764-5085.

PURCHASE -- Part 1 of the Neuberger Museum of Art's exhibition ''Women of Stone,'' featuring sculpture by Barbara Segal. Opens today. ''Whitfield Lovell: Portrayals,'' tableaux that incorporate the artist's drawings and found objects. Closes next Sunday. ''Recent Acquisitions: Gifts From the Lawrence Gussman Collection of African Art'' and ''Welded! Sculpture of the 20th Century.'' Closing Aug. 27. Continuing: ''Selections From the Roy R. Neuberger Collection,'' ''Object and Intellect: African Art From the Permanent Collection'' and ''Ancient Civilizations: Roy R. Neuberger Collection.'' Tuesdays through Fridays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children, free. Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

RIVERDALE -- ''Welcome,'' works exploring ideas of domestic space and the relationship between people and nature, by Roberly Bell, Jeanne Blackburn, Esperanza Cortez, Elizabeth Newman, Francesco Simeti, Carol Sun, Allan Wexler and others. Through next Sunday. Grounds admission: $4; students and people 60 and older, $2; children 5 and younger, free. Free admission all day Tuesdays and Saturdays from 9 a.m. to noon. Gallery of Wave Hill, West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200, ext. 232.
TARRYTOWN -- Drawings, paintings and mixed media by members of the art program of Neighborhood House. Through August. Warner Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.
Children

BEDFORD -- ''Keeping Exotic Animals as Pets,'' informal talk on how to care for these animals and what to do with those that don't work out. Today at 1 p.m. ''Life of a Log,'' learn how insects, worms and even salamanders depend on fallen trees for food and shelter. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Picnic at Lost Pond, a one-mile hike from the museum. Bring lunch. Next Sunday at 11 a.m. All free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Seining by lantern light. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Meet in parking lot of Croton Point Park. (914) 242-7275.

GREENBURGH -- ''Feeding Fun,'' staff member feeds one or more of the center's more than 125 live animals and talks about the animal's eating habits and where it gets its food in the wild. Saturdays at 1 p.m. Free with admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children 2 through 12, $2. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
MAMARONECK -- ''Cinderella,'' presented by Missoula Children's Theater. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; members, $8. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

MOUNT VERNON -- Historic games, toys and songs for children 6 through 10. Tuesday from 10:30 to 11:15 a.m. Demonstration of Colonial cooking, clothing and family life. Thursday at 11:45 a.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

OSSINING -- Exploration of Teatown Lake, discovering the unseen creatures living below the surface. Next Saturday from 9 to 11 a.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Wear clothes and shoes meant for getting dirty. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

RYE -- Playland Park's hours: Sundays and Tuesdays through Thursdays from noon to 11 p.m. and Fridays and Saturdays from noon to midnight. Through Labor Day. Free admission. Rides are three to five tickets each. Cost: individual ticket, 75 cents; $8 for 12-ticket book; $15 for 24-ticket book and $19 for 36-ticket book. Parking: $4 weekdays; $5 weekends; $7 holidays. Fireworks. Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:15 p.m. Through Sept. 1. Parking: $4. Exit 19 of I-95. (914) 925-2700.

RYE -- Musical theater vacation workshop for children 8 through 13. Children learn an entire musical in one week, ending with informal performance (for family members only) on Friday evening. Tomorrow through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. (Also Aug. 21 through Aug. 25.) $290 each; members, $261. Registration. Rye Arts Center. (914) 967-0700.
SOMERS -- ''Scent-sational Summer Day,'' featuring herb activities and crafts. Today from noon to 3 p.m. Free. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

TARRYTOWN -- ''From a Child's Perspective,'' special tours geared for children of Washington Irving's home. Featuring tales of Sunnyside's former child residents, an interactive scavenger hunt, display of period toys and hands-on activities. Thursdays from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 5 through 17, $4. (914) 591-8763.

TARRYTOWN -- Performing arts program for children 6 through 13. Including trip to Manhattan to see Broadway show and culminating in special performance. Aug. 21 through 25 from 9 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Cost: $325; members, $275. Jewish Community Center, 371 South Broadway. (914) 366-7898.
YONKERS -- Film festival. Tomorrow at 2 p.m. free. Getty Square Branch of Yonkers Public Library, 7 Main Street. (914) 337-1500.
YONKERS -- Pajama story and song time, for children in pajamas carrying teddy bears. Wednesdays at 6:30 p.m. Through August. Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.

YONKERS -- ''Seining at Sunset on the Hudson,'' followed by cookout. Program for all ages. Sponsored by Greenburgh Nature Center and Beczak Environmental Education Center. Friday at 6:30 p.m. Cost: $2; members, free. Registration. Beczak Environmental Education Center, Alexander Street. (914) 376-0859.

YONKERS -- ''Sky Tonight,'' sky show for children 8 and older and adults. Fridays at 7 p.m. Free tickets at museum's front desk beginning at 6:30. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 763-4550.
Potpourri

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Eighteenth-century dinners, featuring original Van Cortlandt family recipes served by waiters in period costume. Period music, wines, ales and cider offered with dinner, along with 18th-century games brought out with dessert. Next Saturday and Sept. 9 and 10 at 5 p.m. Cost: $50; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $45. Reservations. Tented lawn of Van Cortlandt Manor. (914) 631-8200, ext. 618.

GARRISON -- One-and-a-half-hour tours of Manitoga's house and grounds, designed by Russel Wright. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tickets: $15; members, $13.50. Reservations. Route 9D, two miles south of Route 403. (845) 424-3812.
GARRISON -- Yearly book sale. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. and next Sunday from noon to 3 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Desmond Fish Library, junction of Routes 9D and 403. (845) 424-3020.

GARRISON -- Fine arts and crafts fair, featuring fiber arts, jewelry, ceramics, paintings, baskets, leather, decorative arts, specialty foods, crafts and demonstrations. Next Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lawn of Garrison Art Center, short walk from Garrison train station. (845) 424-3960.

KATONAH -- Al fresco lunch and tour of Caramoor's gardens. Tuesday at noon. Tickets: $25. Reservations. (914) 232-1253. Formal afternoon tea, after tour of house museum. Thursdays and Fridays at 1:30 p.m. Through October. Tickets: $22. Reservations. (914) 232-5035, ext. 221. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road.
MOUNT VERNON -- Tour of church bell tower. Friday at 3 p.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Celebrating Aaron Copland -- 100 Years,'' exhibition featuring photographs, concert programs, musical manuscripts and other documents of the Copland's life and work. Through August. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

OSSINING -- Teatown Lake Reservation features a 33-acre lake and 14 miles of hiking trails throughout woodlands, meadows, streams and marshlands. Hiking trails are open daily from dawn to dusk. Nature center is open Tuesdays through Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. and Sundays from 1 to 5 p.m. Free. 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.
OSSINING -- Walking tour of the historic Sparta section of Ossining, led by John Lee. Next Saturday at 1 p.m. Free. Meet at Jug Tavern, 74 Revolutionary Road.

PORT CHESTER -- ''Tai Chi for Arthritis.'' Take part in a simple form of Tai Chi, led by Wendy Cali. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Free. Reservations. Wear comfortable clothing and shoes that will not stick or slide. Auditorium of Barron Hall, New York United Hospital Medical Center. (914) 934-3668.

RYE -- House tours of Jay Heritage Center, followed by lemonade on the veranda overlooking Long Island Sound. Sundays, including today, at 2:30 p.m. Through August. Admission: $5; children, free. 210 Boston Post Road. (914) 698-9275.

RYE -- ''Language of Hats: From Poke Bonnets to Pillboxes, From Top Hats to Homburgs,'' display of more than 80 hats from the museum's collection; exploring how hats made statements about the wearer and his or her status (or lack of it) in society. Mondays through Fridays from 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Free. Rye Historical Society and Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Guided tours of the Old Dutch Church and its graveyard. Sundays, including today, at 2 p.m. Through October. Free. 430 North Broadway. (914) 631-1123.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Open mike night, moderated by Reggie Marra. Five-minute limit. Friday beginning at 8 p.m., with sign-up from 7:30. Admission: $3. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
SOMERS -- Program on harvesting and storing seeds from a garden. Next Sunday from 2 to 3 p.m. Cost: $3. Registration. Lasdon Park, Route 35. (914) 232-9147.
VALHALLA -- Yiddish heritage celebration. Today from 5 to 8 p.m. Kensico Dam Plaza, north end of Bronx River Parkway. (914) 242-7275.

WESTCHESTER and PUTNAM -- Sampling of farmers' markets selling fruit, vegetables, wine, eggs, breads, pastry, flowers and organic produce. Saturdays from 8:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. At Manville Road parking lot, off Wheeler Avenue in Pleasantville. Saturdays from 8:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. Off Main Street in Brewster; Municipal lot off Maple Avenue (next to library) in Hastings-on-Hudson; Main and Spring Streets in Ossining and Patriot's Park, Route 9 in Tarrytown.
